entry.title: Plant in OBYC
entry.content:
Hi Team,

In OBYC tcode can we assign plant based on valuation class and G/L Account?

Regards,

Jaya

entry.title: SAP PM Schedule Maintenance - Order
entry.content:
Hello,

we have some schedule maintenance plans in SAP. When we call them (by manuel call or when they be called automatically), some informations in the order are wrong. We have OrderQuantities in the General Task List of the maintenance item. Par expample we need 5 pieces for activity 0010.

After the order is created, we see only the operation quantity of 1 piece for every activity.

Does someone have an idea what the reason for this problem is?

 

Best regards Stefan

entry.title: Account Modifier in cost line of work order

Thanks,

Jaya

entry.title: What's the table(s) that give "equipment usage periods by functional locations"
entry.content:
Hello,

I need to treat some data outside SAP in regards to equipment installation and dismantling from functional locations.

Is there any table that provides this info? Usage list creates one record for each change, including other changes besides mantle and dismantle.

"equipment usage periods by functional locations" would be the most adequate. Is there an equivalent table to this?

Thank you.

entry.title: Plan multidiscipline and multifrequencies with different PM activity - How packages hyerarchy works?
entry.content:
Hello

I'm preparing a maintenance plan including different maintenance items that can have different work centers, different frequencies and different PM activity

In this way I can keep aligned the due dates of all the generated wo. Moreover I would like to avoid the generation of the lower frequencies WO when an higher frequency WO is generated, obviously if the packages hyerarchy is existing in the strategy

Here my issues:

Let's suppose to have a MI done in this way (frequency - work center - PM activity)

1Y - INST - A

If in the plan there is another MI done in this way: 3Y - INST - A the 1Y WO is not generated for sure (same work center and PM activity)

If the other MI is 3Y - MEC - A, the 1Y WO is not generated or it will be generated because the work center is different?

If the other MI is 3Y - INST - B, the 1Y WO is not generated or it will be generated because the PM activity is different?

Waiting for a kind answer

Thanks in advance

entry.title: SAP PM Task List Selection Based on Maintenance Activity Type
entry.content:
We have a business scenario with one PM Order Type and 6 different types of maintenance work (planned maintenance, breakdown, diagnostics, overhaul, inspection, modernization).

For each type of work we would like to maintain a separate Task List.

Is it possible to configure SAP PM in such a way that during PM Order creation the system filters or automatically selects the appropriate Task List based on the Maintenance Activity Type, while still using one Order Type?

Which standard SAP objects should be used for this (Maintenance Activity Type, Task List Usage, Order Type settings)?

entry.title: Unexpected Gap in Order Number Sequence
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

We have identified an issue in the system regarding order number sequencing.

An order was created with the number 4400210, and the next order generated has the number 4408779. This indicates that more than 8,500 order numbers were skipped.

We are unsure why this gap occurred. Could you please help us understand the reason behind this behavior?
Is this expected system behavior, or does it indicate a configuration or technical issue?

Thank you in advance for your support.

 

Best regards,

entry.title: External Resource Setup in SAP RSH
entry.content: We are starting SAP RSH implementation project on S/4HANA 2023 SP01 on-premise system. We plan to manage our routine maintenance activities on SAP RSH and assign the work order operations to named persons. We use a number of contractors (external resources) to conduct the maintenance work. These contractors are not created as employees in our  HR system or have SAP user ID. What is the best way to setup these resources in S/4HANA system with out adding them to HR as an employee? Is there anyway, we can just create Business Partners (like BP with BBP005 role) and use them for resource assignment?

entry.title: Activación de vista de costos en aplicativo Gestión de órdenes de mantenimiento F5241
entry.content:
Buena tarde, estoy tratando de solucionar un inconveniente en el aplicativo " Gestión de órdenes de mantenimiento  ID  F5241", el cual no me muestra los costos aplicados en la orden por mano de obra, materiales y servicios.

En estos momentos en ese Tab esta deshabilitada la función y no se si hay que hacer algo en el sistema para que me muestre los costos de la orden PM.

entry.title: Activating the Cost View in the F5241 Maintenance Order Management Application
entry.content:
Good afternoon, I'm trying to resolve an issue with the "Maintenance Order Management ID F5241" application, which isn't displaying the costs applied to the order for labor, materials, and services.

Currently, the function is disabled in that tab, and I'm not sure if I need to do something in the system to enable it to display the PM order costs.

entry.title: Impact on the processes
entry.content:
Hi Team,

If we do below configuration. What would be the impact:

  1. Define the plan categories for estimated costs, planned costs and baseline costs in Customizing of Controlling under General Controlling > Planning > Maintain Category for Planning. Define the three plan categories (e.g. PMORDER01, PMORDER02, PMORDER03) for the application type Maintenance Order and with No specific usage. Do not allow import, copy or delete.

  2. Define which of the three plan categories that you defined in the previous step is valid for estimated costs, which one for planned costs and which one for baseline costs. You can do this in Customizing for Controlling under General Controlling > Planning > Application-Specific Categories > Maintain Categories for Maintenance Orders. Note that you cannot change this assignment retrospectively.

Regards,

Jaya

entry.title: Equipment Installation and Dismantle app
entry.content:
Hi All , 

Greetings !

In our current system , system is generating maintenance notification and posting material automatically whenever we install or dismantle any equipment using fiori app "Equipment Installation and Dismantle " or IE4N t-code . How can we prevent auto generation of such notification & auto goods movement ? How we can track all the goods movement and all the history for an equipment ? 

Thanking you .

Mohammed

entry.title: PM-Revisions not seen in OIOB
entry.content:
I created a revision using OIOB t-code and I can see the entry in the table, T352R.

However, I cant see the same entry when I go back to OIOB. There are no entries there. 

How do I resolve this?

Thanks and Regards,

Anirudh

entry.title: IH01 – Plant Field Is Prefilled by Default
entry.content:
Hello,

Every time I enter transaction code IH01, the Plant field is prefilled. How can I make this field come up empty for all users?
If a variant has been created, how was this done without entering the FL field? I have seen solutions related to creating a variant with SAP_TCODE_IH01; however, in that case the FL field needs to be filled in as well.

SU3/Parameters

entry.title: SAP ECC 6.0 version: Hierachical strategy
entry.content:
Hello!

How is it hierachical strategy creation in ECC SAP (ECC 6 version). If create hierachical strategy for example and create preventive maintenance plan and select packages 1 WEEK and 3 WEEK. Question: Is is so that on 2 WEEK there is NO any calls?

1 WEEK  H1

2 WEEK  H2

3 WEEK H3

Thanking you .

Mohammed

entry.title: Unexpected Object Lists in Maintenance Orders Generated by IP30 from Mce Plans
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I need your help with an issue related to maintenance plans.

I have maintenance plans that are scheduled daily via job IP30. Some of the maintenance orders created contain object lists (two functional locations). However, I cannot identify where these object lists are coming from, as the maintenance plan itself does not contain any object list.

Do you have any idea where these object lists could be inherited from?
Also, which configuration or master data should I analyze to investigate this behavior?

Thank you in advance for your support.

Best regards,
